sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumseh Sulako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A day after getting its EU candidacy status approved, Ukraine is facing a significant defeat on the battleground as it orders its troops to leave the strategic eastern city of Zver Donetsk. International aid is beginning to arrive in remote parts of Afghanistan hit by the devastating earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Also in the program, there's more evidence of the divided states as the U.S. Supreme Court backs the right to bear arms while the Senate votes to toughen federal gun laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's done. The European Union has granted candidate status to Ukraine, paving the way for the usually long process of joining the bloc. It's a decision that EU leaders have called a historical moment. And it's also a strong message of support to Kyiv, four months after Russia invaded the country.

Now both countries will have to work hard to introduce necessary reforms before starting the accession negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Well let's talk now to our correspondent in Brussels, Maeve McMahon, who's been following this historic summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Maeve, good to see you there. Celebratory scenes and warm words in public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But were those sentiments shared away from the camera?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Can Ukraine now expect its application to be fast-tracked even further?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Well, that's a very good question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I feel that last night we saw heads of state and government smile and extend very warm, supportive messages of support to Ukraine, congratulating dealed by the 27 heads of state and government. But of course you know and the reality is it will be a long, long path ahead to one day seeing a Ukrainian head of state sitting here around that council table discussing various issues. It will be a long, long road ahead because Ascension talks won't even start yet, we still haven't got a date or a timeline for them because there's a lot of hurdles that Ukraine and Moldova have to jump before those talks can even begin.

So yeah, we don't know when this really will become a reality, but for now, people like Ursula von der Leyen, the European Commission President, and Charles Michel, the Council President, looking very satisfied with their personal efforts that they've put as well into trying to make sure that the rest of the bloc signed off on what they wanted, which was Ukraine officially becoming a candidate for EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces defending the eastern Ukrainian city of Siverodonetsk have been ordered to retreat after weeks staving off the Russian advance on the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The towns of Laskotivka and Ryoliks and Rivka have also fallen, and the regional governor of the eastern Donetsk region said yesterday that no town is safe for residents. For some village supply lines could be cut at any moment and volunteers are working to evacuate those residents who haven't already fled. But some refused to leave saying they would rather be united with the Russians. At the same time Ukraine says it is recording between two to three hundred war crimes committed by Russian forces on its territory each day. National police investigators have instituted more than 19,000 criminal proceedings since the beginning of the military aggression on the facts of crimes committed on the territory of Ukraine by Russia's armed forces and their accomplices and other criminal offenses related to the martial law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Declassified U.S. intelligence documents say that the Russian Navy has been given orders to lay mines at the ports of Odessa and Okakiv and have already mined the Dnieper River as part of an ongoing blockade on Ukrainian grain exports.

sentences.sentence: Aid is beginning to trickle into Afghanistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's deadly earthquake has wreaked havoc on the war-torn country already grappling with a humanitarian crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Military helicopters and vehicle convoys are on a mission to reach decimated villages, all in desperate need of provisions.
